label: 奥六郡
本: Capital and Countryside in Japan, 300-1180:  Japanese Historians Interpreted in English . Cornell University East Asia Program . 2006
説明文: the “six marcher districts” of Mutsu Province, which were under the rulership of the Abe family by the mid-eleventh century. The territory became the site of the Former Nine Years’ War (1051-62). Later the “Ôshû Fujiwara,” successors to the Abe as territorial lords of the districts, built their stronghold in Mutsu at Hiraizumi.
